document.masterDocTitle: A redescription of Metopa species (Amphipoda, Stenothoidae) based on the type material. 2. The United States National Museum of Natural History (NMNH)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A redescription of Metopa species (Amphipoda, Stenothoidae) based on the type material. 2. The United States National Museum of Natural History (NMNH)

bibRefCitation.author: Shoemaker
bibRefCitation.refString: Shoemaker, C. R. (1964) Seven new amphipods from the west coast of North America with notes on some unusual species. Proceedings of the United States National Museum, 115, 391 - 429.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality:
Cape Rollin, Simushir Island, Kurile Islands. 419m (
Shoemaker, 1964
)

Material examined. Morphological examination: 7 mm male from Alb. Sta. 4803 (
46 ° 42 ’ N
,
151 ° 45 ’ E
),
June 24, 1906
, 229 fath. ( 419 m ) Cape Rodhin, Simshir Island (Kurile islands, Russia ). This is the type locality, paratypes have been examined (from the same station as the type ). These were also used in the 1964 paper from Shoemaker, the figures were made in 1952 )

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Metopa stelleri
Shoemaker, 1964
, paratype, male, 7mm, Albatross st. 4803: whole animal. Scale bar is 0.5mm.

FIGURE 16.
Metopa stelleri
Shoemaker
, 1964
, paratype, male, 7mm, Albatross st. 4803: labrum, right and left mandible, labium, maxilla 1, maxilla 2, maxilliped. all scale bars are 0.1mm.

FIGURE 17.
Metopa stelleri
Shoemaker
, 1964
, paratype, male, 7mm, Albatross st. 4803: gnathopod 1, gnathopod 2, pereopod 3, pereopod 4. All scale bars are 0.1mm.

FIGURE 18.
Metopa stelleri
Shoemaker
, 1964
, paratype, male, 7mm, Albatross st. 4803: pereopod 5, pereopod 6, pereopod 7, telson, urosome. All scale bars are 0.1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Shoemaker ( 1964 )
mentions that the female is very like the male, but with shorter antennae. He further proposes this species to be close to
Metopa cristata
, from which it differs in the lack of dorsal teeth on pereon segments 1–5 .
Ecology: we know nothing about the ecology.
